intro: Urostigma elegans, commonly known as the elegant bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other mustard family plants. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Its leaves are alternate and pinnately divided, giving it a finely dissected appearance. Urostigma elegans thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in desert environments.
